page.title: 06The Theatre: Pateley
page.content: In Pateley Bridge, there is a small theatre called the Playhouse. The building was originally used as a chapel.The theatre is run by the local Dramatic Society which has one hundred and eighty members. Inside is a small foyer where you can buy tickets. These cost Â£1.35p each. Beyond the foyer is a room where coffee is served. Behind this can be found the kitchen and dressing rooms. From here, the actors can reach the stage by some stairs. All of the actors are amateurs. The theatre has an apron stage, which measures 24 feet by 18 feet. There are seventy three seats for the audience. One person is in charge of making the costumes, but most of the members help in some way. The sets for the plays are produced by the members them- selves. They try to perform at least three plays each year.
